column1:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- In general, any consecutive string of \r and \n (in any order) will be
  treated as one SINGLE line break, except within an enclosed context
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first three will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
- The file must end in a sequence of \r and \n's
- Every cell containing a ^, \r, or \n must be enclosed in "
  - If a " is encountered right after a non-enclosed separator, \r, or \n,
    then the parser is said to enter an "enclosed context", such context
    ends immediately when a non-escaped " that is not followed by \r, \n,
    or a separator is encountered
  - " within each cell should be escaped using another " in front of it,
  - If a " is encountered in a non-enclosed context, and it is not right
    after a separator, \r, or \n, then it is entirely ignored
  - If a non-escaped " is encountered in an enclosed context...
    - If it is followed by a separator, \r, or \n, then it is considered
      the closing quote of the current context
    - Otherwise, it is ignored
  - If a separator, \r, or \n is encountered while in an enclosed context,
    it will be preserved

column3: NonDialogueFontScale

column1: Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size. Recommended setting is around 0.3~0.6.

column2: You’re awake! <var>Cat</var> has been acting... <wavy>strange.</wavy>
column3: 嘿，你总算醒了！<var>Cat</var> 最近一直很... <wavy>奇怪。</wavy>

column2: It started when they touched that Artifact you brought back.
column3: 自从它碰了你上次带回的那块石板

column2: Can you check on <var>Cat</var> outside?
column3: 你该出门看看<var>Cat</var>怎样了

column2: Wha- What's happening?
column3: 这-这是怎么回事？

column2: <var>CatUpper</var> NOOO
column3: <var>CatUpper</var>！别走！！

column2: W-who is taking you away?? Why??
column3: 你为什么在天上？？你快下来！

column2: Oh honey... you have to bring back <var>Cat</var>! I'll research what caused all this...
column3: 甜心...我们必须把<var>Cat</var>带回来！至于它为什么飞走，我可得好好研究一下...

column2: It's even <var>Cat</var>'s birthday tomorrow.
column3: 真不巧，明天可是<var>Cat</var>的生日。

column2: There's some global phenomenon that started last night.
column3: 昨晚闹了个世界性的大新闻。

column2: Some people online have been calling it the "Cataclysm".
column3: 有些人管它叫“灾变”。

column2: Parts of the world are missing, obviously.
column3: 很多地方突然就莫名失踪了。

column2: There's also some magic barrier that won't let anything fall into these missing parts though.
column3: 而且

column2: I think that it all came from that Artifact you brought back last night...
column3: 我觉得这可能都和那个古遗物相关。。。

column2: One good thing about this is that everyone is still relatively calm about this.
column3: 还好人们现在还相对冷静。

column2: Maybe another effect of the Artifact...
column3: --这也可能是那个遗物的影响。

column2: I'm going to keep investigating here.
column3: 我要再好好调查调查这里。

column2: You should go find <var>Cat</var>, who knows what's happening to them.
column3: 你该去找找<var>Cat</var>，我担心它现在怎样了。

column2: Isn't this ol' Cathy's cat? She has a ton of cats.
column3: 这不是老凯茜的猫吗？她养了一大堆猫。

column2: Oh, she might know where <var>Cat</var> is!
column3: 也许她知道<var>Cat</var>在哪！

column2: Sigh... everything reminds me of them.
column3: 哎。。。我想<var>Cat</var>了。

column2: Isn't this ol' Cathy's cat? I think her three cats are out again.
column3: 这不是老凯茜的猫吗？她养了一大堆猫。

column2: Oh, she might know where <var>Cat</var> is!
column3: 也许她知道<var>Cat</var>在哪！

column2: Sigh... everything reminds me of them.
column3: 哎。。。我想<var>Cat</var>了。

column2: I just realized.
column3: <var>Cat</var>在外面也没人喂。

column2: Has anyone been feeding <var>Cat</var>?
column3: 好担心它。。。

column2: What??
column3: 啊？

column2: WHAT????
column3: 什么？？？

column2: Aliens?? Took <var>Cat</var>??
column3: <var>Cat</var>被外星人拐跑了？！！

column2: They exist??
column3: 它们存在么？

column2: Juliet, my love, wherefore art thou?!
column3: 哦，朱丽叶，我的爱人，你在哪里？

column2: Juliet, my love, wherefore art thou?!
column3: 哦，朱丽叶，我亲爱的朱丽叶，你到底在哪里？

column2: Please bring my beloved back, lest I drink this poison!
column3: 快帮我找回朱丽叶，不然我就要服毒自尽！

column2: Your cat? I care not! Where art thou, Juliet?!
column3: 谁管你的猫。。。朱丽叶，你在哪里啊！

column2: Please bring my beloved back, lest I drink this poison!
column3: 陌生人，快帮我找回朱丽叶，不然我服毒自尽！

column2: Tybalt, you swine! Where have you taken Juliet?
column3: 提伯尔特，你这该死的畜生！你把朱丽叶带去哪里了？！

column2:
Oh Juliet! I'll
never leave
you again.
column3:
哦，朱丽叶，我们
再也不要分别！

column2:
Juliet, will you
be mine?
column3:
朱丽叶，我们
白头到老好么？

column2: i wonder what these ruins mean... and where they're from?
column3: 这些遗址背后到底隐藏着什么？我很好奇！

column2: woah! where'd you get that artifact? can i see it?
column3: 伙伴，你这是哪里拿到的宝贝？给我看看！

column2: omg wait! check if this tile fits in.
column3: 等等，你看看这块地能不能拼进去

column2: it totally does!
column3: 机智！

column2: can i try it out? :3
column3: 我能试试吗？嘿嘿嘿：3

column2: no..? finders keepers i guess.
column3: 你怎么这么小气：<

column2: wait. that tile was mine.
column3: 等等，这块地是我的！

column2: sigh...
the caves await.
column3: 洞穴在等着我们

column2: i heard there are more relics in there. im gonna follow the trail to the source.
column3: 听说那里面有更多的遗物，我一定要进去看看。

column2: so... what about these ruins.
column3: 所以，这些遗址。。。

column2: aha! it looks like those ruins pieces might connect.
column3: 懂了，这几块遗址应该连在一起！

column2: an arrow? it must lead to a relic!
column3: 箭头？它肯定指向宝藏！

column2: how do i get there?
column3: 我怎么到这里来了？

column2: this way? no...
column3: 这里吗？好像不是。。。

column2: over here?
column3: 这里？

column2: aHh im so lost! everything keeps moving!
column3: 天旋地转~我好晕~~~

column2: you! follow that arrow!
column3: 快跟着那些箭头！

column2: now these glyphs... we just need to find the final fragment.
column3: 让我看看。。。我们应该只差最后一块遗址了。

column2: tyy! now let me take a look...
column3: 蟹蟹~给我瞅瞅0.0

column2: wOAH! everything is shakingggg
column3: 牛X！震天动地！

column2: aMAZING! did you see that?!
column3: 你看见刚才了吗？！

column2: shoot! i got a bit carried away didn't i
column3: 淦，我刚才有些分心了，是不是。。

column2: we might need your artifact to <wavy>fix the village</wavy>.
column3: 总之，我们需要这个宝贝来<wavy>修复村庄</wavy>.

column2: wow! you'd make a great assistant!
column3: 我去，你真是个好帮手！

column2: im gonna continue exploring the caves up north. you should come!!
column3: 我去北边的洞穴探险啦，你真该跟我一起！！

column2: make sure to grab a map from the Mayor!
column3: 别忘了去村长那里要张地图！

column2: make sure to grab a map from the Mayor!
column3: 别忘了去村长那里要张地图！

column2: stand clear!!
column3: 立正！！

column2: the caves await.
column3: 洞穴在等着我们！

column2: i heard there are more relics in there. im gonna follow the trail to the source.
column3: 听说那里面有更多的遗物，我一定要进去看看。

column2: Not so fast squirt!
column3: 慢着点儿，小崽子！

column2: Get me some coffee first, damn youngin. Head to the beach...
column3: 先给爷端杯咖啡，我把它落在沙滩上了。

column2: Not so fast squirt!
column3: 慢着点儿，小崽子！

column2: Get me some coffee- Already grabbed it, eh?
column3: 先给爷端杯—欸，已经拿来了？

column2: Hmph, already cold.
column3: 淦，这玩意儿早凉了。。。

column2: Finally my damn coffee… Took you long enough.
column3: 可算来了，够慢的。

column2: Screw off, kid.
column3: 滚吧，小犊子。

column2: Help! My buoys have gotten tangled up. Can you help untangle them?
column3: 嗨呀，我的浮标都缠住了！能帮我解开他们吗？

column2: Thanks! I'll be at the beach some time soon.
column3: 感激不尽！我正赶去沙滩。

column2: Rumor is there are new fish in the water.
column3: 传言说

column2: Was gonna hit the ocean soon, but my boating license expired.
column3: 我本来要出海，可驾照过期了。

column2: You've got your license! Hurry on now, let's set sail!
column3: 你有驾照吧？快，我们出航！

Yes, oh

上帝啊，亲爱的，

column2: The fish aren't coming upstream anymore, I'll be out a job!
column3: The fish aren't coming upstream anymore, I'll be out a job!

column2: I could really use a fish right now, fish right now.
column3: I could really use a fish right now, fish right now.

column2: Ah, the ocean! If only I knew how to fish the open seas.
column3: Ah, the ocean! If only I knew how to fish the open seas.

column2: But alas, I can only fish the river by the waterfall.
column3: But alas, I can only fish the river by the waterfall.

column2: The river's together. Is there a traffic jam downstream?
column3: The river's together. Is there a traffic jam downstream?

column2: Something fishy is going on here...
column3: Something fishy is going on here...

column2: The fish are coming back! Time to whip out the old pole.
column3: The fish are coming back! Time to whip out the old pole.

column2: Heard there was one in the caves, but also pirates. Scary!
column3: Heard there was one in the caves, but also pirates. Scary!

column2: Good luck out there, say hi to <var>Cat</var>.
column3: Good luck out there, say hi to <var>Cat</var>.

column2: I'm going back to fishing the river.
column3: I'm going back to fishing the river.

column2: Woah! You have one of the relics they've been digging up these days.
column3: Woah! You have one of the relics they've been digging up these days.

column2: They've all been resurfacing ever since the earthquake last night.
column3: They've all been resurfacing ever since the earthquake last night.

column2: I wonder what other relics people have been finding... maybe I should go look for one!
column3: I wonder what other relics people have been finding... maybe I should go look for one!

column2: Wh-where'd you get that?! That Archeologist was looking all over for that fragment.
column3: Wh-where'd you get that?! That Archeologist was looking all over for that fragment.

column2: Did you hear? The railway in the caves was shut down.
column3: Did you hear? The railway in the caves was shut down.

column2: Apparently the bridge was burnt.
column3: Apparently the bridge was burnt.

column2: Those scientists... they should have been more careful with that new crystal research.
column3: 那些科学家，他们该更小心对待水晶研究的。

column2: Did you hear? There's fighting at the Lowlands apparently.
column3: 你听说了吗？最近低地那边一直在闹。

column2: Like, the deployed the military for it.
column3: 他们甚至出动了军队。。。

column2: Seems quite worrying to me.
column3: 我有点担心。

column2: I… am Chad! And the credit for returning this fragment is mine!
column3: 嘿伙计，我是王大力！我可是把这块碎片搬回村里的功臣！

column2: Up here, short stuff. Ha! You can't even jump.
column3: 小矮子，你跳不上来吧？哈哈哈！

column2: What are you gonna do? Cry?
column3: 这就急啦？

column2: Nothing can bring me down!
column3: 你可憋想把我从这弄下来

column2: Woah, what's shaking?
column3: 我靠，什么在晃？

column2: My neck! My back! How will I get this to the archeologist now?
column3: 哎呦~我的背，我的腰！这下我可怎么把这玩意儿交给考古学家。

column2: You better not take my credit. I worked hard to become an RA.
column3: You better not take my credit. I worked hard to become an RA.

column2: What? How dare you take my credit?!
column3: What? How dare you take my credit?!

column2: You won't beat me again, explorer. Chad never loses twice in a row!
column3: 走着瞧，旅行者！我王大力不会输第二回！

column2: You won't beat me again, explorer. Chad never loses twice in a row!
column3: 走着瞧，旅行者！我王大力不会输第二回！

column2: You saved us all! I can finally get back to baking... and...
column3: You saved us all! I can finally get back to baking... and...

column2: Hunting for all nine of the rarest Breadge... and...
column3: Hunting for all nine of the rarest Breadge... and...

column2: Looking for The Legendary Cheeseburger!
column3: Looking for The Legendary Cheeseburger!

column2: Woah! You got a piece of Breadge?!
column3: Woah! You got a piece of Breadge?!

column2: Rumor says that combining all nine can make something to rival the taste of The Legendary Cheeseburger.
column3: Rumor says that combining all nine can make something to rival the taste of The Legendary Cheeseburger.

column2: Good luck on your quest, sous-chef!

column2: WoAH! ALL NINE PIECES!!
column3: WoAH! ALL NINE PIECES!!

column2: Maybe you were The Legendary Cheeseburger the whole time...
column3: Maybe you were The Legendary Cheeseburger the whole time...

column2: But... it's so far... I can't wait to get going.
column3: But... it's so far... I can't wait to get going.

column2: It's so close! I can't swim on land, though.
column3: It's so close! I can't swim on land, though.

column2: If I could swim up the river I could make it.
column3: If I could swim up the river I could make it.

column2: No time to lose, gotta blast!
column3: No time to lose, gotta blast!

column2: The wife thanks you as well, by the way.
column3: The wife thanks you as well, by the way.

column2: The Archeologist is missing, huh.
column3: The Archeologist is missing, huh.

column2: I guess I'll have to do her job.
column3: I guess I'll have to do her job.

column2: The ruins... you got a connection!
column3: The ruins... you got a connection!

column2: Woah! The diviner still works.
column3: Woah! The diviner still works.

column2: Now... Just find the final part to this spell.
column3: Now... Just find the final part to this spell.

column2: Great! Now let me cast it...
column3: Great! Now let me cast it...

column2: Fuwaaaaaaaaaa!
column3: Fuwaaaaaaaaaa!

column2: There! Now use The Artifact to reconnect the village.
column3: There! Now use The Artifact to reconnect the village.

column2: There! Now use The Artifact to <wavy>reconnect the village.</wavy>
column3: There! Now use The Artifact to <wavy>reconnect the village.</wavy>

column2: Great! I'll be heading out now, take care.
column3: Great! I'll be heading out now, take care.

column2: Use <U>/<L>/<D>/<R> to move
Press <Action> to interact
column3: 按 <Action> 交互

column2: Press <Tab> to open the Artifact
column3: 按 <Tab> 使用古遗物

column2: Use the mouse to move sliders
column3: 鼠标点击移动地块

column2: Press <Action> for more dialogue from some NPCs
column3: 按 <Action> 推动角色对话

column2: Press <Action> to pick up items
column3: 按 <Action> 捡起物品
